long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
The versions of perl-Code-TidyAll in Fedora 24 and 25 are outdated: perl-Code-TidyAll-0.49-1.fc25 (Released July 2016) perl-Code-TidyAll-0.44-1.fc24 (seamingly an inoffical, never formally released snapshot)
Please consider to update them a more recent version.
Origin of this request is me being unable to add perl-Code-TidyAll-Plugin-Test-Vars to fedora 24 and 25, because it requires Code::TidyAll > 0.50
perl-Code-TidyAll-0.56-3.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-8d7d1201ed

There was bigger changes in 0.50 and I don't want to add it to Fedora 24.
Btw, Code-TidyAll-0.44 was official release (BZ#1325875)

(In reply to Jitka Plesnikova from comment #2) > There was bigger changes in 0.50 and I don't want to add it to Fedora 24. Yep. This change is the reason for Code-TidyAll-Plugin-Test-Vars to want 0.50.
> Btw, Code-TidyAll-0.44 was official release (BZ#1325875) Hmm, http://search.cpan.org/dist/Code-TidyAll lists 0.20, then 0.48, but no 0.44.
Also, neither http://cpansearch.perl.org/src/DROLSKY/ (current maintainer) nor http://cpansearch.perl.org/src/JSWARTZ/ (previous maintainer) has it.
